definition: An attention mode where an agent focuses processing resources on a subset of stimuli or information while suppressing others.

positive_examples: She ignored the noise in the room and concentrated on the speaker’s words.
The agent filtered out irrelevant tokens and focused on the user’s question.
I tried to only pay attention to the key performance indicators on the dashboard.
negative_examples: He noticed everything going on around him all at once.
The model processed every field in the record equally.
The camera captured the entire scene without any filtering.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not just any attention; specifically focusing on a limited subset of available inputs while ignoring others.
